frontmatter.title: Building your first add-on with the Document API
frontmatter.description: This is an in-depth tutorial that will guide you in the creation of a Grids add-on for Adobe Express using the Document API

questions.question: What does this tutorial teach me to build?
questions.answer: A fully functional Grid System add-on that creates rows, columns, spacing (gutters), and color overlays.

questions.question: What's the difference between iframe and Document Model Sandbox?
questions.answer: iframe hosts the UI and logic; Document Model Sandbox allows direct document manipulation via the Document API.

questions.question: What are the prerequisites for this tutorial?
questions.answer: HTML/CSS/JavaScript knowledge, Adobe Express add-ons familiarity, Adobe Express account, and Node.js 20+.

questions.question: How do I get the project files?
questions.answer: Clone the GitHub repository or download ZIP from express-add-on-samples/document-sandbox-samples/express-grids-addon.

questions.question: What UI framework does this tutorial use?
questions.answer: Spectrum Web Components for consistent Adobe design system integration.

questions.question: How does communication work between iframe and sandbox?
questions.answer: Through the Communication API that connects the iframe UI with the Document Model Sandbox.

questions.question: What Document API concepts are covered?
questions.answer: Node insertion, creating/manipulating shapes, grouping elements, context permanence, and color management.

questions.question: Can I start from a blank template instead?
questions.answer: Yes, use the express-addon-document-api-template but manually add shapeUtils.js and Spectrum imports.
